fields.summary: Network Server's failure to rollback local transactions on shutdown can cause  hang on startup with message java.net.BindException: Address already in use: NET_Bind in derby.log

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Closing a prepared statement with an embedded   XAConnection can cause the statement to be reprepared and errors related to missing dependencies. This can interfere with network server closeSession()

fields.summary: jdbcapi/XATest.java  doesn't seem to be running anywhere
fields.environment: jdbcapi/XATest  does not seem to be included in any suite.  It currently fails in testMorph because a transaction is active when a connection is closed.  I think the error is correct and the test needs to be changed.

comments.body: Added a link to DERBY-3998, which contains some more information about tests not being run.
This test would sometimes hang with DERBY-4053 symptoms so cannot be enabled until that is fixed.

After Mamta's fix for DERBY-4053 I tried enable this test and ran suites.All three times.
First time I got well past XATest and my machine froze up in teh replication tests and I had to reboot.

Second  run I hit DERBY-4053 (even with the fix) a

Third run I hit a different problem:
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Column value mismatch @ column 'STATUS', row 1:
    Expected: >PREPARED<
    Found:    >IDLE<
        at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
        at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.assertRowInResultSet(JDBC.java:1095)
        at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.assertRowInResultSet(JDBC.java:1007)

        at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
        at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:22)
        at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:19)
        at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
        at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:23)

        at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:22)

        at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
        at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:23)
        at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)
        at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:22)
        at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:19)
        at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
        at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:23)
        at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
        at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
        at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
        at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
        at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
        at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
        at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
        at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
        at junit.textui.TestRunner.doRun(TestRunner.java:116)
        at junit.textui.TestRunner.start(TestRunner.java:172)
        at junit.textui.TestRunner.main(TestRunner.java:138)

This failure caused subsequent tests to run very slowly because of lock timeouts in CleanDatabaseSetup because there was a statement left prepared.  I am going to try again with just the jdbcapi suite.

I changed the test to check for an unordered result set to avoid the PREPARED vs IDLE error above and get fairly consistently this issue on network shutdown running the test standalone if I use the derby-4053_diag_diff.txt patch.  I am guessing this error is the one that caused DERBY-4053 in the second run.

I am guessing this is some kind of embedded bug regarding closing BrokeredStatements when the referenced table had been dropped.  I will try to get  a stand-alone repro for that.

author.name: espinha
author.emailAddress: tiago dot derby at espinhas dot net

comments.body: I'm submitting a patch to this issue. This patch adds the XATest to the respective suite and adds two fixtures to test DERBY-4310. I'll be adding another patch to the other issue that fixes the behavior described on the comments.

updateAuthor.name: espinha
updateAuthor.emailAddress: tiago dot derby at espinhas dot net

comments.body: Resolving for 10.6. If backported DERBY-4310 needs to be backported as well.

Now that XATest has been enabled we have increased exposure to DERBY-4158. If there are any more backports of DERBY-4310 and DERBY-4155, All changes need to be backported to void slow tests and other issues if any of the XATest fixtures fail.
This fix appears to have been merged to the 10.5 branch in time to get onto the next release train so I am marking this as fixed in 10.5.3.

author.name: espinha
author.emailAddress: tiago dot derby at espinhas dot net

comments.body:
Indeed, this issue was merged to 10.5 on revision 802397.

I'm closing the issue as for now I don't think we will be merging it to other branches.

updateAuthor.name: espinha
updateAuthor.emailAddress: tiago dot derby at espinhas dot net

comments.body:
reopening issue to look at backporting it to 10.3.  I am trying to backport fix for DERBY-4731
but this is blocking my testing of it there.

I backported the test changes associated with this issue to 10.3.  

backporting the current state of XATest.java and XAtestUtil.java from trunk
to 10.3 branch. Disabled the test for DERBY-4731, to be enabled later when
that is backported. It looks like all of the changes for the rest of this
issue were already backported to 10.3 as part of the backport of DERBY-4310.
